    • Class GamePanel extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • a

          javax.swing.JButton a
          Holds the button representing choice A.

        • b

          javax.swing.JButton b
          Holds the button representing choice B.

        • c

          javax.swing.JButton c
          Holds the button representing choice C.

        • d

          javax.swing.JButton d
          Holds the button representing choice D.

        • questionLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel questionLabel
          Holds the Label which holds the question/clue.

        • currentQuestion

          Question currentQuestion
          Holds the question which is currently being viewed (question stage only).

        • questionCounter

          javax.swing.JLabel questionCounter
          Displays the current question and the total number of questions to the user.

        • pauseButton

          javax.swing.JButton pauseButton
          Holds the button which is used to pause and unpause the game.

        • timeLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel timeLabel
          Displays the amount of time remaining to the user.

        • currentClue

          java.lang.String currentClue
          Holds the text of the clue that is currently being viewed.

        • feedbackLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel feedbackLabel
          Displays an 'INCORRECT' message if user chooses a wrong answer.

        • atQuestionStage

          boolean atQuestionStage
          Holds a boolean value: if TRUE, the user is at the Country stage. if FALSE, the user is at the Travelling Stage.

        • levelCounter

          javax.swing.JLabel levelCounter
          Displays the number of levels remaining to the user.

        • destinations

          Country[] destinations
          Holds the three destinations at the Map Stage.

        • answer

          int answer
          Holds 0,1 or 2, representing the correct answer to the clue.

        • timer

          GameTimer timer
          The GameTimer Instance which controls the timing of the game.

        • background

          java.awt.Image background
          The background image.

        • imageLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel imageLabel
          Holds the background Image on the screen.

        • mapImageLabel

          javax.swing.JLabel mapImageLabel
          Holds the travelling map image.

    • Class PrintTester extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

    • Class ScarletGemMain extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • currentCountry

          Country currentCountry
          Holds the country that the user is currently in. This value will be reassigned to a new value every time the user completes a level.

        • difficulty

          int difficulty
          Holds the number representing the difficulty chosen by the user at the start of the game. 0 represents easy. 1 represents medium and 2 represents hard.

        • levelsRemaining

          int levelsRemaining
          Holds the number of levels that the user has left. In easy mode, this is initialized to 3. In medium mode, this is initialized to 6. In hard mode, this is initialized to 9. When difficulty reaches 0, the game ends. It is initialized to -1 in order to check whether the user started the game or not.

        • alreadyBeen

          java.util.ArrayList<E> alreadyBeen
          Holds the instances of each country that the player visited. This makes sure that the player will not visit the same country twice.

        • gamePanel

          GamePanel gamePanel
          Holds the instance of the GamePanel class. This is initialized only once per game, and contains the buttons and menus used in the game.

        • levelCounter

          javax.swing.JLabel levelCounter
          Displays the number of levels that the user still has to complete in order to win the game. Will be refreshed every time the user travels to a new country.

        • mainMenuPanel

          MainMenuPanel mainMenuPanel
          Holds the instance of the MainMenuPanel, which contains the buttons at the start of the game. This is only initialized once, and reappears every time the user completes a level.

        • highScoresViewer

          HighScoresViewer highScoresViewer
          Holds the instance of the HighScoresViewer which the user can see at any time using the menu option or by pressing Ctrl+E. This is only initialized once.

        • currentQuestion

          int currentQuestion
          Holds the number 1 or 0, depending on which question the user is currently on.

        • helpMenu

          javax.swing.JMenu helpMenu
          Displays help .chm file.

        • fileMenu

          javax.swing.JMenu fileMenu
          Menu which contains Save, Print, View High Scores and Exit items.

        • howToPlayItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem howToPlayItem
          Opens the Instructions viewer when the user selects this menu choice.

        • printItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem printItem
          Opens the Print dialog when the user selects this menu choice.

        • saveItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem saveItem
          Saves the user's progress when the user selects this menu choice.

        • exitItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem exitItem
          Closes the game window when the user selects this menu choice.

        • highScoresItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem highScoresItem
          Opens the High Scores viewer when the user selects this menu choice.

        • helpItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem helpItem
          Opens the .chm help file when the user selects this menu choice.

        • aboutItem

          javax.swing.JMenuItem aboutItem
          Opens the About dialog when the user selects this menu choice.

        • score

          int score
          Holds the user's current score

        • userName

          java.lang.String userName
          Holds the user's name (When he/she wins the game).
